items.title: Consumer prices rise 2.7% annually in July, less than expected amid tariff worries
items.description: The CPI was projected to increase 0.2% in July and 2.8% for a year ago on headline, and 0.3% and 3% on core

items.title: Trump-Putin talks are already a triumph for Moscow, its economy and markets
items.description: Economists say the talks are "already a win" for Putin, whose economy is limping along after three years of war.

items.title: From lipsticks and Labubu dolls to concerts, the 'treatonomics' trend is booming in uncertain times
items.description: Spending on mood-boosting products and experiences is proving resilient as consumers seek a morale boost in hard and uncertain times.
